item.description:
Another film from the Coolidge's Goethe Institut series.

About the film:

The film portrays Hannah Arendt during the four years (1960-1964) that she observes, writes, and endures the furious reception of her work about the trial of the Nazi war criminal, Adolf Eichmann in Israel.

Watching Arendt as she attends the trial, staying by her side as she is both barraged by her critics and supported by a tight band of loyal friends, we experience the intensity of this powerful Jewish woman who fled Nazi Germany in 1933. With Barbara Sukowa as Hannah Arendt. Directed by Margarethe von Trotta.

After the film we'll go to an area restaurant for a discussion.

Hope you can make it!

Lisa
item.how_to_find_us: After the film I'll be near the exit holding a Meetup sign.
item.name: Hannah Arendt
